channel.title: Spring
channel.description: Level up your Java code and explore what Spring can do for you.

item.title: Spring Shell 2.1.12, 3.0.7 and 3.1.3 are now available
item.dc:creator: Janne Valkealahti
item.content:encoded:
Spring Shell 2.1.12, 3.0.7 and 3.1.3 are now available

On behalf of the team and everyone who has contributed, I'm happy to announce that Spring Shell 2.1.12, 3.0.7 and 3.1.3 has been released and are now available from Maven Central.

Please see the release notes 2.1.12, release notes 3.0.7 and release notes 3.1.3 for more details.

Thanks to all those who have contributed with issue reports and pull requests.

How can you help?

Project Page | GitHub | Issues | Documentation

item.title: A Bootiful Podcast: Spring team legend Dr. David Syer on view rendering technologies, the latest-and-greatest, SpringOne 2023, and more
item.dc:creator: Josh Long
item.content:encoded:
Hi, Spring fans! In this installment Josh Long talks to the legendary Dr. David Syer about view rendering technologies, SpringOne, and more.

Have you registered for SpringOne yet?

Are you interested in learning Spring? Check out Spring Academy.

item.title: This Week in Spring - July 25th, 2023
item.dc:creator: Josh Long
item.content:encoded:
Hi, Spring fans! Welcome to another installment of This Week in Spring! Look, I'm going to level with you. This is the view from where I'm staying on holiday right now in tropical Lankawi, Malaysia:

I'm super interested in this week's roundup, as always, but I'm also very interested in that oh-so-blue water. Let's get this show on the road!

  • A Bootiful Podcast: Java legend Simon Martinelli on Vaadin, JavaOOQ, and so more
  • Jul 20 - How VMware RabbitMQ Can Help You Build Tomorrow's Enterprise IoT Applications
  • MQTT 5.0 support is coming in RabbitMQ 3.13
  • Spring Framework 6.1 M3 released
  • Spring Security 5.6.12, 5.7.10, 5.8.5, 6.0.5, and 6.1.2 are available now, including fixes for CVE-2023-34034 and CVE-2023-34035
  • Want to know what VMWare can do to help you with Spring? Spring Solutions | VMware Tanzu
  • This article looks at relative energy efficiencies across different JVMs. Among other things, we can see that GraalVM native images are very energy efficient. Java, writ large, is also very energy efficient
  • Spring ViewComponent (not an official Spring project) lead Thomas Schueuhly and I looked at Spring ViewComponent and then looked at optimizing Spring ViewComponent for GraalVM in this video. You might find the demo or the pair programming interesting.
  • Have you registered for SpringOne yet? It's next month! In lovely Las Vegas, and it's going to be amazing! I hope you'll join the good, the great, the amazing Dr. Syer, myself and most of the Spring team there for our first in-person SpringOne event since 2019!

item.title: Spring Security 5.6.12, 5.7.10, 5.8.5, 6.0.5, and 6.1.2 are available now, including fixes for CVE-2023-34034 and CVE-2023-34035
item.dc:creator: Josh Cummings
item.content:encoded:
On behalf of the team and everyone who has contributed, I am pleased to announce that the Spring Security 5.6.12, 5.7.10, 5.8.5, 6.0.5, and 6.1.2 are available now.

Please refer to the releases page for more detail on what is included in each release.

Those versions fix the following CVEs:

  • CVE-2023-34034: WebFlux Security Bypass With Un-Prefixed Double Wildcard Pattern
  • CVE-2023-34035: Authorization rules can be misconfigured when using multiple servlets

It is also important to remember that the 5.8 version of Spring Security is a special release designed to help you to migrate to Spring Security 6.0, therefore if you are planning to upgrade your applications, using that version combined with the special migration guide makes the migration a lot smoother.

Project Page | GitHub | Issues | Documentation

item.title: Spring Boot 3.2.0-M1 available now
item.dc:creator: Andy Wilkinson
item.content:encoded:
On behalf of the team and everyone who has contributed, I'm happy to announce that Spring Boot 3.2.0-M1 has been released and is now available from https://repo.spring.io/milestone.

This release includes 141 enhancements, documentation improvements, dependency upgrades, and bug fixes. Notable new features include:

  • Initial support for virtual threads when running on Java 21
  • Auto-configuration for Spring Framework's new RestClient
  • Logging changes for improved observability
  • Numerous dependency upgrades, including new milestones of several Spring projects

Please see the release notes for more details and upgrade instructions.

Thanks to all those who have contributed with issue reports and pull requests.

How can you help?

If you're interested in helping out, check out the "ideal for contribution" tag in the issue repository. If you have general questions, please ask on stackoverflow.com using the spring-boot tag or chat with the community on Gitter.

Project Page | GitHub | Issues | Documentation | Stack Overflow | Gitter

item.title: A Bootiful Podcast: Java legend Simon Martinelli on Vaadin, JavaOOQ, and so more
item.dc:creator: Josh Long
item.content:encoded: Hi Spring fans! In this installment Josh Long talks to Java legend Simon Martinelli about Vaadin, Spring, JavaOOQ, and more. This episode was recorded live from beautiful Barcelona, Spain at the amazing Spring I/O show!

item.title: Spring HATEOAS 2.0.6, 2.1.2 and 2.2 M2 released
item.dc:creator: Oliver Drotbohm
item.content:encoded: I am happy to announce the availability of Spring HATEOAS 2.0.6, 2.1.2 and 2.2 M2. All releases solely ship a fix for a regression in our AOT reflection metadata generation so that applications building native images continue to work on the upcoming Spring Boot releases.
